options.title: -C
options.description: Show CPU statistics. This is enabled by default unless the -D, -d, or -T flags are used.

options.title: -c count
options.description: Repeat the display count times. Unless the -I flag is in effect, the first display is for the time since a reboot and each subsequent report is for the time period since the last display. Unless overridden by the -w option, the wait interval between lines is 1 second.

options.title: -D
options.description: Show alternate disk statistics. Displays kilobytes transferred, number of transfers, and time spent in transfers. Use of this flag disables the default display.

options.title: -d
options.description: Show disk statistics. This is the default. Displays kilobytes per transfer, number of transfers, and megabytes transferred. Use of this flag disables display of CPU and tty statistics.

options.title: -I
options.description: Show the running total values, rather than an average.

options.title: -M core
options.description: Extract values associated with the name list from the specified core instead of the default /dev/mem.

options.title: -N system
options.description: Extract the name list from the specified system instead of the default “/bsd”.

options.title: -T
options.description: Show tty statistics. This is enabled by default unless the -C, -D, or -d flags are used.

options.title: -w wait
options.description: Pause wait seconds between each display. Unless a count is specified via the -c option, iostat will display output until it is interrupted.
